Title: AI Research Tech Lead, Large Language Models
Description:
Our mission at Duolingo is to develop the best education in the world and make it universally available. But we’ve got more left to do — and that’s where you come in!

Duolingo is the world's most popular learning app. Beyond our core learning product, we also offer English proficiency testing with the Duolingo English Test, and are bringing new subjects into the Duolingo app, where people can develop their Math and Music skills.

We are passionate about educating our users, making fact-based decisions, and finding innovative solutions to complex problems. We offer meaningful work, limitless learning opportunities, and collaboration with world-class minds. Come brighten your life and over half a billion more!

We are looking for an experienced AI Research Engineer to lead our Large Language Model team. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record as a Technical Lead or Manager, with extensive experience in developing, training, and fine-tuning large neural networks. Experience with LLMs is highly desirable, but we also welcome candidates skilled in vision or other deep learning networks. This role requires leading a talented team of engineers, guiding them in innovating and adapting LLMs to meet the internal needs of Duolingo, which may include fine-tuning LLMs, creating NLP data pipelines, working with open source LLMs, deploying models on-device, etc.

You Will…

Lead a team of backend and AI Research engineers, fostering a collaborative and innovative work environment.Oversee the development and fine-tuning of large-scale neural network models, with a focus on language models.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their needs, to align the large language model goals with company objectives.Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in machine learning, particularly in LLMs, and apply this knowledge to drive advancements in our projects.Mentor team members, providing guidance and support in their professional development.Ensure the delivery of high-quality, scalable, and efficient machine learning solutions.

You Have…

Proven experience as a Technical Lead or Manager, preferably in LLMs or related fields.Strong background in training and fine-tuning large neural networks.Advanced degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field with a focus on machine learning or artificial intelligence.Excellent leadership and communication skills, with the ability to manage and inspire a team.Deep understanding of machine learning concepts, frameworks, and best practices.

We invest in and support our Duos! This role is eligible for a robust compensation package of base salary, equity, and Duolingo’s world-class benefits. The starting base salary range for this role is, $197,500 - $374,000 . Actual salary may vary based on level, work experience, performance, and other factors evaluated during the hiring process.

We will do everything we can within reason to make sure that your interview takes place in an environment that fairly and accurately assesses your skills. If you need assistance or accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

Take a peek at how we care for our employees' holistic well-being with our benefits here .

Duolingo is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Title: Market Research & Insights Project Manager
Description:
MARKET RESEARCH & INSIGHTS PROJECT MANAGER Are you a seasoned market researcher who thrives in an environment that encourages you to be an out of the box thinker? An analytical storyteller with creative vision? Someone who enjoys building relationships? A self-starter who values personal growth, as well as growing and inspiring those around you?
We are seeking a sharp, highly engaged Insights Project Manager who embodies all of the above to join our team of like-minded researchers, analysts and creative professionals. The ideal candidate will have at least 4-6 years of experience in an agency setting and possess a solid working knowledge of both quantitative and qualitative primary market research methodologies.
We are looking for someone who…· Loves being in the driver’s seat when it comes to project management and client relationships· Is self-motivated and has an inquisitive approach to problem solving· Is adept at translating respondent feedback and data into powerful insights and recommendations· Is meticulous when it comes to details and all-around organization· Is exceptionally skilled at both written and oral communications and is comfortable leading client meetings· Is able to reprioritize as necessary and juggle multiple assignments and heavy/changing schedules, includingsome travel· Enjoys the nature of agency work, and understands not every day fits within the traditional 9-5· Has some exposure to SPSS and WinCross
Here at TideWatch, no two days are ever alike, and we consider that a good thing! On any given day, you’ll be the lead on a number of different projects with the global brands with which we have the privilege of working, across a broad range of industries, from personal banking to off-road vehicles to human and animal health, just to name a few.
The work is fast paced, but rewarding, and you’ll have the opportunity to continue to fine tune your market research skillset while being responsible for conceptualizing and authoring the project deliverables, from screeners to guides to questionnaires to final reports and video sizzles. You will also work closely with Senior Directors/Management to ensure the execution of these materials, and ultimately, the studies meet and/or exceed the TideWatch standard of excellence.
While it’s important that you be a good fit for this position, we also understand we should be a good fit for what you’re looking for, too.
We are a small, highly collaborative team that works hard, but also looks for ways to have fun (especially important given our virtual workplace).
We offer a competitive salary, 401K match, healthcare coverage, generous paid time off, a monthly internet stipend and the opportunity for ongoing education.
At the end of the day, we take pride in the work we do, and are looking for a strong Project Manager who also takes pride in the work they do to round out our team. If this sounds like you, we invite you to apply and share more about yourself and your experience. We look forward to getting to know you.
Please submit resumes to jobs@tidewatch.com.

Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The opportunity

On the Design Research & Strategy team, our mission is to lay a user-centered foundation for Adobe product design and development. We are seeking a Senior Experience Researcher to drive research from initial, early exploration through to shipping new features/products for Adobe Firefly.

What we do:

Assess project scope, form appropriate research questions, develop a realistic research plan, identify appropriate research methods (including developing new methods when necessary), run research studies from start to finish, recruit participants, synthesize data into actionable findings, and present findings to a broad range of stakeholders. Build alliances across the company to identify new partners, drive teamwork, and deeply understand the business context of research problems. We engage with different roles and product teams to understand and influence business goals, system architecture, and product designs. Advocate for the customer by articulating research findings and product ideas through clear and insightful presentations. We often present work in group-wide or company-wide forums (e.g., brown bags, tech summit, MAX, KTB, etc.). Mentor junior staff and supervise contractors/vendors on more complicated programs of study. 

Who we are looking for:

Requirements:

Significant hands-on research experience, with at least 5 years of experience in an industry setting (e.g. UX/product research, consulting, etc.)At least 3 years of experience conducting user research with teams of people in large companies/enterprises. Experience working with developer communities as the end user, specifically about APIsCan collaborate well across all project roles (design, research, product management, engineering, sales, etc.)Demonstrated ability to drive research that informs the develop of new technology. An undergraduate degree from a 4-year, accredited institution. Able to handle areas (user/product/domain) that may be ambiguous or ill-defined. An understanding of the product life cycle and can time research to have maximum impact. Experience with ethnographic research. Awareness of UX industry trends, incorporating new research techniques when appropriate. Strong organizational, planning, and time management skills. Don’t just summarize study data, but go one step further to identify significant user needs and/or product issues. Can proactively identify and communicate clear product solutions based on these findings, sometimes across departments. Experience communicating work at the management, director, and VP levels. 

Nice to haves:

Experience conducting research for AI/ML-first products/technology. Familiarity with GenAI technologies. An advanced degree in HCI, Human-Centered Design, or a directly related field. Familiarity with or interest in Adobe’s creative (Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator) and/or Experience (Analytics, AEM, etc,) tools. 

Why you’ll love working here

Collaborate with and learn from other researchers from a wide range of backgrounds; Psychology, Anthropology, HCI, Computer Science, Design and Management, Linguistics, and more. At Adobe, we value the differences in others’ stories and ideas— You’ll be able to bring your authentic self to work every day. Description:
Join a leading fintech company that’s democratizing finance for all.

Robinhood was founded on a simple idea: that our financial markets should be accessible to all. With customers at the heart of our decisions, Robinhood is lowering barriers and providing greater access to financial information. Together, we are building products and services that help create a financial system everyone can participate in.

As we continue to build...

We’re seeking curious, growth minded thinkers to help shape our vision, structures and systems; playing a key-role as we launch into our ambitious future. If you’re invigorated by our mission, values, and drive to change the world — we’d love to have you apply.

About The Role

Research has been central to our product development and business strategy since the very beginning - and our team continues to grow, along with our user base and product. Working in the research team at Robinhood, you'll help us systematically understand how people interact with financial products and how they think and feel about money.

The role is located in the following office locations (Menlo Park, CA; New York, NY; or Seattle, WA) which will align with our in-office working environment. Please connect with your recruiter for more information regarding our in-office philosophy and expectations.

What You'll Do

Proactively and independently identifying high-impact questions from a product or business perspectiveAnswering those questions with a strong command of qualitative and quantitative methods, using the right method at the right timePlanning and leading research end to end, including strategic, foundational, iterative, and evaluative researchRepresenting the voice of the user throughout the whole product development process, working closely with PMs, designers, engineers, and leadershipClearly communicating your research insights for teams to translate research findings to product and business impactContributing to the development of an evidence-driven understanding of Robinhood users and potential users

What You Bring

At least 2-3 years of industry qualitative or quantitative research experienceBackground in Human-Computer Interaction, Psychology, Behavioral Economics, Anthropology, Sociology, or similarRecord of applying your research skills to build product and business impactStrong work ethic, excellent organization and communication skillsLove and care for your craftPreferred to have experience or knowledge of advanced trading strategies such as options trading

What We Offer

Market competitive and pay equity-focused compensation structure100% paid health insurance for employees with 90% coverage for dependentsAnnual lifestyle wallet for personal wellness, learning and development, and more!Lifetime maximum benefit for family forming and fertility benefitsDedicated mental health support for employees and eligible dependentsGenerous time away including company holidays, paid time off, sick time, parental leave, and more!Lively office environment with catered meals, fully stocked kitchens, and geo-specific commuter benefits

Title: Senior UX Researcher
Description:
Geico is looking for a highly skilled and experienced Senior UX Researcher. As a Researcher, you will play a critical role in shaping the user experience of our products and services through insightful research and data-driven insights.

This role will be supporting our Acquire team. This associate will focus on

simplifying shopping by attracting the right customer through an integrated marketplace, guiding customers to the right offerings.

 

This position is a hybrid role, and it is required to be on-site 3 days a week at one of the following locations: 

Chevy Chase MD, Atlanta GA, Chicago IL, Seattle WA, New York NY, Indianapolis IN*

 

 

Job Responsibilities:

Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers, designers, and engineers, to develop a comprehensive research strategy aligned with business goals. Identify research opportunities, prioritize initiatives, and create roadmaps for executing research studies.  Oversee and participate in all phases of the user research process, including user recruitment, study design, data collection, analysis, and reporting. Utilize various qualitative and quantitative research methods, such as usability testing, surveys, interviews, and competitive analysis, to gain deep insights into user needs and behaviors.  Analyze research data, identify patterns, and generate actionable insights that drive informed design decisions. Communicate research findings to stakeholders in a clear and compelling manner through reports, presentations, and interactive workshops.  Collaborate closely with product managers, designers, engineers, and other stakeholders to advocate for user-centered design principles. Act as a strategic partner, providing valuable insights and recommendations throughout the product development lifecycle.  Stay up to date with the latest research methodologies, tools, and industry trends. Continuously evaluate and improve research practices, ensuring the team is equipped with the right resources and techniques to deliver impactful results.  Collaborate with Product Operations and other stakeholders to develop and manage the research budget effectively. Optimize resource allocation to ensure research activities are conducted efficiently and within allocated budgets.  

  

Basic Qualifications: 

3+ years of experience in user experience research 3+ years of experience in both qualitative and quantitative research methods, including usability testing, surveys, interviews, and ethnographic research.  

 

Preferred Qualifications  

Bachelor's Degree or equivalent years of experience in research   Strong expertise in both qualitative and quantitative research methods, including usability testing, surveys, interviews, and ethnographic research.  Proficient in data analysis and visualization tools, such as PowerBI, or Tableau.  Solid understanding of user-centered design principles and methodologies.  Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex research findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.  Demonstrated ability to influence cross-functional teams and drive user-centric design decisions.

Title: Quantitative Researcher, Education Systems & Policy
Description:
Overview

Join AIR as a Quantitative Researcher with our  Education Systems & Policy  (ESP) team and be involved in our longstanding legacy of providing rigorous, impartial evidence-based research and resources on pressing and perennial education issues. The ESP team studies and supports organizations and infrastructure at the local, state, and national levels focusing on the people who operate PK-12 education systems to improve the organization of schooling and advance the organizations within those systems.

We are seeking a Researcher with an understanding and practical experience in employing quantitative research methodologies to contribute to research and evaluation projects and business development activities.

This position has the flexibility to work remote from anywhere in the United States or from any of AIR's U.S. office locations . This does not include U.S. territories.

About AIR

Established in 1946, with headquarters in Arlington, Virginia, AIR is a nonpartisan, not-for-profit institution that conducts behavioral and social science research and delivers technical assistance to solve some of the most urgent challenges in the U.S. and around the world. We advance evidence in the areas of education, health, the workforce, human services, and international development to create a better, more equitable world.

AIR’s commitment to diversity goes beyond legal compliance to its full integration in our strategy, operations, and work environment. At AIR, we define diversity broadly, considering everyone’s unique life and community experiences. We believe that embracing diverse perspectives, abilities/disabilities, racial/ethnic and cultural backgrounds, styles, ages, genders, gender identities and expressions, education backgrounds, and life stories drives innovation and employee engagement. Learn more about AIR's Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Strategy and hear from our staff by clicking here .

Responsibilities

The responsibilities for the position include:

 Analyze, interpret, and report on complex quantitative data using appropriate statistical and/or psychometric methods (multiple linear regression, HLM, Structural Equation Modeling, IRT, etc.)  Lead the design and planning of research studies using quasi-experimental or experimental research designs  Coordinate and manage field based, district and/or school level data collection activities including interviews, structured observations, focus groups, and document review  Write reports, including briefs, charts, and graphs that describe and interpret findings of analyses for clients  Contribute substantively, thoughtfully, and creatively to the conceptualization and design of education studies, including research proposals  Communicate effectively with clients, site-based staff, and other stakeholders  Manage project and team organization, including taking notes during internal meetings, making and updating project timelines, and ensuring documents are uploaded to a shared drive 

Qualifications

Education, Knowledge, and Experience:

 Ph.D. in education, psychology, sociology, or other related field, or Master’s degree with 4-7 years of relevant work experience  Expertise or experience in at least one of the following: Course taking and high school to post-secondary transitions  College and career readiness  Career and technical education  Improving outcomes for adult learners  Strong methods knowledge (prefer What Works Clearinghouse certification)  Demonstrated knowledge and experience of research principles and research design  Knowledge of various analytic and data management software (e.g., SPSS, EXCEL, STATA, NViVO and Access). 
Skills

 Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate efficiently in a virtual work environment  Ability to lead data analysis activities using descriptive and inferential statistics and able to manage the analysis of interview and focus group data  Ability to communicate research findings to internal and external audiences  Demonstrated familiarity with the organization of data, including database structure, record layouts, and file structure  Available to travel locally and nationally 

Disclosures

This position is open to U.S. citizens only. Upon hire, incumbent will be required to obtain clearance through the Electronic Questionnaires for Investigations Processing (e-QIP) system .

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without discrimination on the basis of age, race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.

AIR adheres to strict child safeguarding principles. All selected candidates will be expected to adhere to these standards and principles and will therefore undergo reference and background checks.

AIR’s Total Rewards Program , i s designed to reward our staff competitively and motivate them to achieve our critical mission. This position offers an anticipated annual salary of $85,000 - $115,000. Salary offers are made based on internal equity within the institution and external equity with competitive markets. Please note this is the annual salary range for candidates that are based in the United States.

AIR maintains a drug-free work environment .

Fraudulent Job Scams Warning & Disclaimer

AIR is aware of individuals falsely presenting themselves as AIR representatives. Fraudulent job scams seek to extract sensitive information or money from victims. To protect yourself, please be aware that AIR recruitment will only email you from an “@air.org” domain. Please take extra caution while examining the email address, for example jdoe@air.org is correct and jdoe@aircareers.org is not a legitimate AIR email address. If you are unsure of the legitimacy of a communication you have received, please reach out to recruitment@air.org .

If you see a job scam, or lose money to one, report it to the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) at ReportFraud.ftc.gov . You can also report it to your state attorney general . Find out more about how to avoid scams at ftc.gov/scams .

Description:
We’re looking for an Sr. Experimentation Scientist/ Statistician to be a part of the Experimentation Science and Research teams at Chewy. This individual contributor will help us build a “Culture of Experimentation”, accelerate product development and learning through rapid experimentation and help Chewy build differentiated experiences for pet parents and partners everywhere. In this high-visibility, high-impact role, you’ll provide structure to this complex space, and identify iterative steps that add new value early and often for experimenters while still heading towards a long-term vision.

Role

This role is inherently cross-functional; you will work closely with product managers, engineering, analytics, project management, design, marketing, finance, and executive teams to identify product insights, develop and grow business opportunities, and enhance our customer experience. As a successful leader, you’ll:

Define and operationalize experimentation best practices, statistical and scientific methodologies and scalable frameworks for creating, monitoring, and learning from experiments.Build close relationships with internal experimentation platform users, understand their preferences and gaps in their experiences and empower them to run rapid, trustworthy online experiments through training, office hours, documentation, and ad-hoc supportProvide consulting on test design (power analysis), choosing the right metric, defining clear hypothesis and rollout criteria, anomaly detection, and manual test readoutsPartner with experimentation engineering team for consistent adoption and implementation of experimentation platform SDK, and building out toolkit for developers for consistent activation of experiment across different page and platform owners.Ensure quality of data and computation by developing monitoring and alerting mechanisms to catch spillovers and bias, and provide guidance on step-wise identification of root-caseOnboard metrics directly on the platform in order to scale the computation and enable automated readouts. Employ statistical methods and dashboards to reduce false discovery through multiple-comparisons.Build out templates and processes for consistent communication & socialization of test results, and scale learnings through a centralized knowledge repo.Build out and operationalize data science models to calculate annualized incremental lift on output metrics such as revenue. Create models to measure long-term impactResearch and recommend different testing capabilities and causal inference techniques (A/B/n testing, holdback, pre-post, MAB, targeted delivery etc) based on relevant use casesPartner with existing experimentation platform provider to prioritize Chewy’s experimentation use cases, and periodically evaluate latest experimentation platforms in the marketDefine methods and metrics for measuring the platform & program's success, and communicate those metrics with senior leadership. Title: Senior Researcher, Customer & Market Insights
Description:
We all depend on healthcare throughout our lifetimes, for ourselves, and our families and friends, but it is notoriously difficult to navigate and understand. As an industry that comprises 20% of the US economy we think healthcare should work better for all of us. At Collective Health we believe it’s time for a new day in healthcare where as members we are informed and empowered to make the right care choices when the decisions are urgent and critical.

The Insights team at Collective Health delivers actionable insights about what our members, customers, and the healthcare market need. We achieve this by planning and executing research to inform our sales, marketing, product and operational strategies, and by partnering closely with our design/operations teams to deliver products and services that our customers love, and customer-facing teams can confidently sell and represent.

Collective Health team is looking for a curious, self-starting Senior Customer & Market Insights analyst to evolve and expand our Customer Insights (B2B) program. Reporting to the Director of Insights, this person will be responsible for driving and expanding existing Customer Insights initiatives (ie customer discovery interviews, surveys, engagement analytics)—and evolving the program to support our growing business through timely, targeted, and actionable Insights about our customers. Our Customers include our clients (benefit leaders at companies with self-funded benefits plans), health insurance brokers and consultants, and partners across the health insurance ecosystem.

The ideal candidate for this position has strong business acumen, healthcare expertise/experience, and is comfortable in customer-facing settings, ie conducting 1:1 interviews with customers, running focus groups, etc. This role will be visible across the organization, and has the opportunity to develop broad influence on decision-making at every level of our company.

What You'll Do 

Plan and conduct primary and secondary customer research, in close partnership with our Customer Success, Sales/Marketing, Product and Operational teams.Primary: interviewing customers, leading focus groups, designing and fielding surveys, conducting design/concept testsSecondary: analyzing current/past digital engagement, profile, and other customer dataExecute high-level, strategic research projects that combine business and site analytics with direct customer research, and relevant business context.Building and managing a company-wide insights dashboard that provides relevant Market observations and customer data—across our book of business, and broken out by customer segment—to cross-functional teams.Partnering with other Insights team members to “connect the dots” between B2B and B2C insights initiatives.
To Be Successful In This Role, You'll Be

A strategic thinker who can translate data into insights that address business needs.Comfortable with ambiguity, and skilled at helping others find clarity.A skilled relationship-builder, who understands how to build and keep the trust of many cross-functional partners.An analytics whiz who can pull and analyze customer profile data, sales funnel data, survey response data, and digital engagement data, and spot what actually matters across it all.Comfortable, professional, and quick on your feet in front of clients and partners.A curious and confident self-starter who takes initiative when they see opportunities, and brings their colleagues along with them.An expert communicator and storyteller who can communicate findings—including tough feedback for our teams to act on—in a compelling, meaningful, and actionable way.

Required Skills/Experience

This person must have 4+ years of professional experience in B2B or B2C research, either as a primary or secondary function of their role. (For example, Sales or Commercial Enablement roles, while not research-first, may include regular research and analytics activities that would make you a great candidate for this position).Experience in analytics, business intelligence, survey design and analysis. Excellent presentation-building skills (PowerPoint, Google Slides) and a good eye for concise data visualization; concise/clear and compelling writing skills (ie one-pagers).Exceptional communication skills and ability to synthesize findings for broad, cross-functional audience leadership. Some experience in healthcare, ideally with some insurance/payer-side.

Preferred Skills/Experience

Experience with Looker, SQL, Tableau (or other visualization/dasboarding software).A knowledge of Qualtrics, Userzoom, dscout, Quantum Metric, Sermo and/or IQVIA .

Pay Transparency Statement

This job can be performed in a location where we have an office: San Francisco, CA, Lehi, UT, or Plano, TX, with the expectation of being in office at least two weekdays per week.

The actual pay rate offered within the range will depend on factors including geographic location, qualifications, experience, and internal equity. In addition to the salary, you will be eligible for stock options and benefits like health insurance, 401k, and paid time off. Learn more about our benefits at https://jobs.collectivehealth.com/#benefits.

$113,600—$142,000 USD

About Understood

Understood is a nonprofit focused on shaping the world for difference. We raise awareness of the challenges and strengths of people who learn and think differently. Our resources help people navigate challenges, gain confidence, and find support and community so they can thrive.

Having a Shared Commitment To Our Values Is a Key Factor In Any Hire We Make. We Have Five Core Values

Continuously learn.Act with intention.Champion difference.Inspire change.Grow together. 

Come be part of an organization with an entrepreneurial spirit that’s helping to shape the world for difference. Together, we can build a world where everyone can reach their full potential.

To learn more about Understood, please visit: www.understood.org.

Who you are

To advance Understood’s mission and to further our impact, we’re hiring an Applied Research Scientist, reporting to our VP, Expertise & Strategic Design. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in scholarly research, combined with at least 4 years of experience in applied industry settings such as start-ups or tech companies. If you are adept and enjoy the challenge of balancing rigor with business needs, can creatively adjust to the quick cycles of product development, and enjoy leveraging your skills in a wide variety of ways while working on behalf of a larger mission, this role may be a great fit for you.

This is a hybrid opportunity, which requires three (3) days per week in our NYC office.

What you’ll do

Generate research-based insights that help the team make evidence-based decisions about program and product developmentEvaluate the impact of our interventions and offerings - both on and off the platform - generating clear findings on effectivenessWork across the program and product development lifecycle, in partnership with our data analytics team and intervention designers, to ensure any new offering is designed for ease of measurementExecute end-to-end design of quantitative and qualitative approaches to evaluation of both on-platform and off-platform offeringsConduct analysis of both qualitative and quantitative evaluationDeliver clear, concise presentations on your findings for both internal and external stakeholders including but not limited to written reports for funders, visual decks for interdisciplinary internal stakeholders, white papers, and prioritized top-line findings that inform iterationHelp develop and execute a rigorous yet highly usable approach to the evaluation of external products and programs from other organizations, including apps, school-based interventions, and non-profit programsBuild guardrails and approaches to ensuring responsible, beneficial use of new technologies such as LLMAs needed, collaborate on, or independently execute pilot studies on Understood initiatives from design to implementation to final submissions for publicationServe as subject-matter expert on effective approaches to behavior change for children, parents, and adults

Must-haves

Advanced degree (PhD) in psychology, education, public health or other related field in applied social sciencesDepth of experience conducting and leading rigorous, primary research (academic settings)At least 4 years of experience in applied industry settings such as start-ups or tech companies (non-academic)Technical skills and capacity including SQL, R, and Python (or willingness to learn)Strong agility in adjusting methods and approaches based on time and resource constraintsSubject matter expertise in learning and thinking differences, such as Dyslexia and ADHDA deep understanding of user experience, and the development of measurement strategies that don’t diminish the experience of those we serveDepth of experience working in partnership, effectively and with humility, with interdisciplinary colleagues from data & analytics to marketing to product developmentExpertise in managing time, commitments, and prioritiesCommitted to embodying and being a steward of our commitment to diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging 

Nice-to-haves

Strong history of peer-reviewed publishingStrong history of non-peer-reviewed, rapid-cycle, credible summaries of findingsAt least 3 years of experience working as a practitioner, such as a teacher, counselor, or coach - with children who learn and think differently

Title: Director of Research Analytics
Description:
Department: Research Analytics

Salary/Grade: EXS/13

Job Summary

This Director of Research Analytics reports to the Assistant Vice President for Research, Finance and Business Operations and leads the Research Analytics unit. The Director works closely with the AVP to build and share analytics expertise, to promote a data-driven culture, and to help the Vice President for Research to derive meaningful insight into research performance against internal goals and external benchmarks. The Director also partners with the Provost Office Information and Analytics unit on strategic issues related to acquiring and interpreting research data.

The Director collaborates with leaders of OR administrative units to develop and implement projects that enhance the performance of their units, and support the OR strategic plan. The Research Analytics office should provide metrics guidance, identify patterns to find risks and opportunities about performance and other outcomes for all of OR and its subunits. The Director, in collaboration with Research IT and other campus partners, will develop requirements for data storage and downstream analysis and implement new solutions as necessary. This includes, but is not limited to, data for research, financial operations, HR, and facilities.

The Director maintains knowledge of the research enterprise at Northwestern, assesses research trends in higher education, and cultivates relationships with peer schools to identify best in industry practices that can be applied to or enhance the research data analytics progress.

The Director of Research Analytics will support the OR mission and values of understanding empathy, modeling accountability, ensuring fairness, embracing community, and valuing creativity.

Specific Responsibilities

 Conduct needs assessment, engaging with leadership across OR, to determine and prioritize projects. Manage projects and meet expectations, ensuring timelines and deliverables are met. Gather and analyze data pertaining to ongoing and potential projects. Identify appropriate methodologies, procedures, timelines, and other campus partners necessary to complete projects in an accurate and timely way. Develop and maintain databases related to projects conducted by the Research Analytics unit. Build the Research Analytics unit and develop an analytics team to address data analytics needs, leading the team in querying, extracting, managing and analyzing multiple, complex datasets ensuring data integrity and quality. Partner closely with Research IT to ensure automated, repeatable, documented results. Enhance OR data sources, in collaboration with Research IT and other campus partners, by developing new mechanisms for data storage and analysis. This new data layer should draw from current system infrastructure (finance, HR, IRB, IACUC, Northwestern Scholars, etc.) and connect separated models into a reporting layer. The reporting data layer is to be provided as an informational data source for other OR directors and their metric needs. Partners with the Provost Office Information and Analytics unit on strategic issues related to research data. Provide recommendation and guidance on faculty research portfolios. Provide the connection to Research Deans and Office for Research leadership. Formulate and present findings in a clear and understandable format, appropriate to the audience, for a wide range of users at all levels of the organization. Write analytical reports, develop presentations and create data visualization, including tables and charts, to be presented to University Officers, Deans, Directors, and project work groups. Manage the process of coordinating and assembling data pertinent to the Office for Research annual strategic plan and accomplishments. Research and assess research trends in higher education and other areas; keep current with the knowledge through literature, best practices and techniques in data science, business intelligence, and management communities. Cultivate relationships with peer schools to identify best in industry practices that can be applied to or enhance the research data analytics progress. Serve on related university committees and task forces.

 Miscellaneous 

Performs other duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications

 Master’s degree from an accredited institution in a field such as statistics or educational research; or appropriate combination of education and data analytics experience. 6-8 years data management experience, preferably in higher education, or other major non-profit research and development organization.

 Minimum Competencies: (Skills, knowledge, and abilities.) 

 Demonstrated knowledge and familiarity with a variety of programming and analytical tools, such as Business Intelligence platforms, Tableau software, Python, R, and SQL databases. Ability to use and understand data from a variety of sources with an emphasis on data accuracy and integrity. Ability to quickly learn new data-sets and data management systems. Ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing. Familiarity with and ability to use the latest data visualization technologies and preparation of presentations for diverse audiences. Exceptional project management skills and the ability to balance competing priorities from multiple requesters. Ability to work effectively and collaboratively with a wide variety of university constituencies. Ability to work with sensitive information, often of a confidential nature. Familiarity with national datasets relating to the higher education research enterprise.

Preferred Qualifications

 Work experience in a university research environment. Demonstrated experience in quantitative and qualitative analysis of development of new tracking and reporting systems, and/or research design to support research administration in higher education. Experience preparing reports or other briefing materials for high-level decision makers.

 Preferred Competencies: (Skills, knowledge, and abilities) 

 Detailed knowledge of higher education practices, including methodologies for tracking performance in sponsored research and research administration. Detailed knowledge of research information management and benchmarking systems such as Elsevier Pure, Symplectic Elements, Academic Analytics, or similar. Detailed knowledge of state, national and international research data-sets and platforms such as the NSF NCSES databases (including the HERD), NIH RePORTER, other federal research funding agency databases, etc.

Title: Research Director
Description:
About the Company:

Octave is a modern behavioral health practice creating a new standard for care delivery that’s both high-quality and accessible. With in-person and virtual clinics in multiple states, the company offers evidence-based individual, couples, and family therapy, while pioneering relationships with payers to make care more affordable through insurance. By raising the bar on how care is delivered and how providers are supported, we are building a sustainable system that values equity, affordability, and effectiveness.

About the Role:

The Research, Director will be responsible for leading and growing Octave’s research program and quality initiatives. This position will provide insights in support of our clinical and operational leadership teams. The research will include analysis of provider level data, broader performance of all providers in our network as well as patient specific progress. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in social sciences with a focus on research of psychotherapy outcomes and delivery of quality care. This position is expected to lead and support our mission to bring quality, outcomes driven mental healthcare to millions of insured individuals.

Management Responsibilities:

Provide day to day leadership and guidance to the various operational teams, ensuring professional development and performance management in achieving goals and objectives.Foster a positive, inclusive and collaborative work environment.Oversee the planning, execution, and completion of projects and initiatives within the team.Establish and monitor operational processes and workflows to enhance efficiency and productivity.Balance data driven needs with execution and operational capabilities in a multi-state network of providers. Implement best practices, monitor key performance indicators (KPIs), and develop strategies to achieve excellence.


Responsibilities Include:

Work closely with Clinical and Operational leadership to provide guidance and insights for the clinical program, including further establishing quality and performance standards. Collaborate with Business Intelligence and Business Operations teams and analysts for data inputs. Oversee allocation of various resources to achieve goals for the research program, specifically assessing the impact and effectiveness of psychotherapeutic interventions via evaluations of the outcomes data and our QA program. Utilize both quantitative and qualitative research methods to gather, analyze and synthesize data. Contribute to the delivery of effective care from our network of providers with data driven QA insights.Lead the efforts towards publication of analyzed data for various audiences. Support representation of Octave’s clinical quality and performance with external parties.Embody and incorporate Octaves values.


Preferred Qualifications:

PsyD, PhD in social sciences or equivalent experience conducting research. Minimum 5 years’ experience in a combination of operational settings, people management or consulting roles. Startup experience is strongly preferred.Passion for mental health and changing the healthcare landscape.Proven work and/or academic experience in conducting applied effectiveness research in behavioral health. Familiarity with research methodologies, statistical analysis, data based decision making and business analytics tools such as Tableau and ExcelProficiency in quantitative and qualitative data analysis, as well as experience with use of statistical software such as SPSS, R or similar. Ability to present complex research findings to diverse audiences. Experience implementing quality initiatives and/or programs.Strong interpersonal skills and a preference to work as part of a team.


Octave's Company Values:

The below values drive our day-to-day operations.

We’re human beings first. We operate with empathy and kindness – with our clients, with our collaborators, and with ourselves.People deserve better than status quo. We’re willing to tackle the intractable problems, no matter how big, because someone should. We ask big questions, we craft big solutions, and we challenge ourselves and others to make it happen.No bystanders. No stars. No tourists. Each person has been selected to be here, and with that comes a responsibility to bring your expertise, share your ideas, and help make this company better.Partnership paves the path ahead. We don’t operate in a silo, internally or externally. To transform the system, we believe in working with others to create something bigger, better, and stronger.Quality is crucial at scale. Quality is core to our business, and we refuse to sacrifice it as we grow.Progress is a process. In the pursuit of progress, we iterate, reflect, learn, adjust – and always leave things better than we found them.There are people behind every data point. We recognize that numbers tell only one part of the story, and we also do the work to understand impacts at the individual level.


Physical Requirements:

Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer. Must be able to frequently communicate with others through virtual meeting applications such as Zoom and Google Meet. Must be able to observe and communicate information on company provided laptop. Move up to 10 pounds on occasion. Must be eligible to work in the United States without sponsorship now or in the future.


Compensation:

Octave is committed to pay equity. To maintain our commitment to pay equity, Octave will follow Pay Transparency regulations on all open job postings. Current Pay Transparency laws require companies to include a position's salary or hourly wage range (not including bonuses or equity-based compensation) in any internal or external job posting. This requirement extends to job postings published by a third party at an employer's request.

Octave will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with Octave’s legal duty to furnish information.

Starting pay for qualified applicants will depend on a combination of job-related factors, which may include education, training, experience, location, business needs, or market demands. The expected salary range for this role is set forth below and this range may be modified in the future.

The salary range for this role is $85,900 - $123,500.

Additionally, this position is eligible for the following benefits: company sponsored life insurance, disability and AD&D plans. Voluntary benefits such as 401k retirement, medical, dental, vision, FSA, HSA, dependent care and commuter/parking options are also available. Octave offers generous Paid Time Off as well as paid parental leave benefits.
